tool.name: QualityControl
tool.description: Computes various QC metrics from many possible input files (only the consensusXML is required). The more optional files you provide, the more metrics you get.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re #import os.path
## Preprocessing mkdir in_cm && ln -s '$in_cm' 'in_cm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cm.ext)' && #if $in_raw: mkdir in_raw && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_raw/%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4]) for _ in $in_raw if _])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_raw/%s/%s.%s' && " % (_, os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_raw if _])} #end if #if $in_postFDR: mkdir in_postFDR && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_postFDR/%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4]) for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_postFDR/%s/%s.%s' && " % (_, os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out && #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_cm && #end if #if "out_feat_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_feat && mkdir ${' '.join(["'out_feat/%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4]) for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} && #end if #if $in_contaminants: mkdir in_contaminants && ln -s '$in_contaminants' 'in_contaminants/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_contaminants.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_contaminants.ext)' && #end if #if $in_trafo: mkdir in_trafo && mkdir ${' '.join(["'in_trafo/%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4]) for _ in $in_trafo if _])} && ${' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_trafo/%s/%s.%s' && " % (_, os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_trafo if _])} #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in_cm 'in_cm/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_cm.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_cm.ext)' #if $in_raw: -in_raw ${' '.join(["'in_raw/%s/%s.%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_raw if _])} #end if #if $in_postFDR: -in_postFDR ${' '.join(["'in_postFDR/%s/%s.%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} #end if #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_cm 'out_cm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' #end if #if "out_feat_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_feat ${' '.join(["'out_feat/%s/%s.%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext("featurexml")) for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} #end if #if $in_contaminants: -in_contaminants 'in_contaminants/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_contaminants.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_contaminants.ext)' #end if #if $in_trafo: -in_trafo ${' '.join(["'in_trafo/%s/%s.%s'"%(os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_trafo if _])} #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing #if "out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mztab")}' '$out' #end if #if "out_cm_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_cm/output.${gxy2omsext("consensusxml")}' '$out_cm' #end if #if "out_feat_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') ${' '.join(["&& mv -n 'out_feat/%(bn)s/%(id)s.%(gext)s' 'out_feat/%(bn)s/%(id)s'"%{"bn": os.path.basename(str(_))[:-4], "id": re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), "gext": $gxy2omsext("featurexml")} for _ in $in_postFDR if _])} #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: tolerance
param.label: m/z search window for matching peaks in two spectra

param.name: assume_all_target
param.label: Forces the metric to run even if target/decoy annotation is missing (accepts all pep_ids as target hits)

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: out_cm
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_cm
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_cm_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

collection.name: out_feat
collection.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_feat
collection.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_feat_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Computes various QC metrics from many possible input files (only the consensusXML is required). The more optional files you provide, the more metrics you get.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_QualityControl.html
